result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J. Goodlet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Payment of all court obligations and supervision fees.

No consumption of alcohol or any illegal drugs.
No entrance in to any bars or any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and the DOC.
Follow any recommendations made by agent.
If defendant successfully completes probation, pays all fines, pays DNA surcharge and successfully serves jail sentence he is to write a letter to Judge Miron asking for expungement.

timeConds.notes: Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody J. Goodlet in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon.  Kent Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:57PM
Also, 14CF100- dismissed but read in for sentencing
Court spks on charges and penalties
Court spks on PSI
ADA has no objections
Atty Brabazon spks on issues with PSI
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Brabazon spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes: Ct1- 1 year, 6 month initial confinement. 2 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP and SAP.- Imposed and stayed
90 days jail with huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.
Def remanded into custody of MSD
3 years probations with conditions:
Maintain full-time employment
No consumption of alcohol or any illegal drugs
No entrance into any bars or any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Payment of all court obligations and supervision fees
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and the DOC.
Follow any recommendations made by agent
Fine +costs=$540 +$250 DNA surcharge= $790
CT 2- 1 year, 6 month initial confinement. 2 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP and SAP- Imposed and stayed. 
To be served concurrent to ct 1
If def successfully completes probation, pays all fines and DNA surcharge, and successfully serves jail sentence, he is to write a letter to judge asking for expungement.
